id: Jennifer Aniston wins the InStyle Awards red carpet with her hairstylist in tow
paragraph: 135.6m sharesIf anyone knows how to rock a red carpet, it’s Jennifer Aniston.Team her how-the-heck-does-she-get-it-so-glossy hair with her stunning long, black, thigh-split gown and she’s got a winning combination for the red carpet at the InStyle awards. It was all about her despite the awards not being about her at all – she wasn’t nominated as the ceremony celebrate stylists in the film and fashion industries.The 49-year-old had the man behind her good locks on hand should a hair fall out of place, long-term pal Chris McMillan, who was nominated for hairstylist of the year at the awards.That man deserves all the gongs for making her hair a celeb in its own right, and should probably take a quick trip to London so he can help sort out our barnets.The Big Bang Theory’s Kaley Cuoco also walked the red carpet at the event at the Getty Centre in LA.Lea Michele, Jeff Goldblum and Julia Roberts were all sachaying their way into the ceremony along with Jen.That glow Jen appears to have about her may well be one of triumph, having scored the thumbs up for her vocals on the track Push and Pull for Dolly Parton’s Netflix show Dumplin’.According to ET, Jennifer was ‘nervous’ to record her vocals but did absolutely fine.Her credit was revealed when Dolly posted the tracklisting and cover art for the soundtrack along with her co-star’s Danielle Macdonald.Jennifer plays Rosie Dixon in the drama, which sees the plus-size teenage daughter of a former beauty queen sign up for her mum’s (Aniston) Miss Teen Bluebonnet pageant as a protest that escalates when other contestants follow her footsteps, revolutionising the pageant and their small Texas town.MORE: Ariana Grande shares sweet video of ex Mac Miller smiling a month after his deathMORE: Jada Pinkett Smith never wanted to marry Will Smith: ‘I cried the whole way down the aisle’
